alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 19 at 3:04PM EDT until April 20 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures of 28 to 32 in valleys expected. * WHERE...Knox and Bell Counties. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The coldest temperatures and greatest threat for a hard freeze will be in valleys. Across ridgetops, temperatures will remain near or above freezing, limiting the frost threat.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
